concept.title: Purpose of the Muffler
concept.shortdesc: The muffler reduces engine exhaust noise by controlling gas expansion and release while maintaining efficient exhaust flow.

section.title: Noise Reduction Function
section.p: Without a muffler, engine exhaust flowing through the exhaust pipe would produce constant and distracting noise. The muffler's larger chambers allow the exhaust gases to expand from the smaller exhaust pipe, reducing their force before final discharge. This expansion process results in nearly silent operation.

section.title: Muffler Design
section.p: The muffler is specifically designed to minimize back pressure from escaping gases. This efficient design means there is no performance benefit from installing an exhaust cut-out between the engine and muffler.
